info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 5:48PM CDT until April 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR TENSAS...SOUTHWESTERN MADISON...NORTHERN CONCORDIA...NORTHERN CATAHOULA...SOUTH CENTRAL RICHLAND...FRANKLIN PARISHES IN NORTHEASTERN LOUISIANA AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 548 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bakers to 7 miles northwest of Aimwell, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Bakers and Crowville around 555 PM CDT. Wallace Ridge around 610 PM CDT. Newellton, Somerset and Afton around 615 PM CDT. Wildsville around 620 PM CDT. Frogmore around 625 PM CDT. Clayton and West Ferriday around 630 PM CDT. Ferriday around 635 PM CDT. Spokane around 640 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Harrisonburg, Gilbert, Baskin, Sicily Island and Ridgecrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
